intro: Lepidostemon glaricola, commonly known as the glaricola thyme, is a small shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming from late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often used in traditional Māori medicine. Lepidostemon glaricola thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat.
